channel.title: Postgres on YING ZHEN LI
channel.description: Recent content in Postgres on YING ZHEN LI

item.title: PostgreSQL
item.description: Setting up a password for the postgres role By default, local connections to PostgreSQL use the peer authentication sys- tem. That means that instead of asking for a password, they check to see if we are currently logged into a user (a linux user) that matches a user name in Postgres. We are going to change the way we do authentication and instead tell Postgres to use an encrypted password, but first we need to actually set a password for the postgres user.
